entry.title: TechEd 2025 in Berlin - Recap on planning in SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
It has already been a week since I boarded my train home from Berlin after an exciting TechEd 2025. Coming back from such an event always feels a bit like returning to reality ‚Äî all the nicer to look back on the sessions I had the honor of hosting and the great conversations with customers and partners in the meeting center, at the demo booth, and beyond. 

In case you missed TechEd, don't worry. We have got you covered. 

Virtual Sessions:

Together with @jie_deng  and @matthiaskraemer, I hosted session DA207 - Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud which is available on-demand on the TechEd virtual website (registration required). We had a full house, lots of interesting questions and loads of live demos (and no demo system let us down üôè). We discussed the overall strategy of SAP Analytics Cloud in the context of SAP Business Data Cloud. On the planning side, we gave an outlook on our priorities for 2026 and highlighted recent innovations in seamless planning and GenAI. We could also showcase great new features like MyMetrics, Horizon theme support and provided a labs preview at how we want to further empower the story designer in SAP Analytics Cloud. 

Besides, I recommend these sessions (again, registration is required):

Session ID & NameSpeakersLink
ST107v | SAP Business Data Cloud: Strategy, architecture, and visionTorsten Ammon
SVP - Head of Business Data Cloud Core 
Prakash Nanduri
Global Head of Product Management BDC&I
Link
DA806v | SAP Business Data Cloud solution road mapTorsten Ammon
SVP - Head of Business Data Cloud Core 
Kristian R√ºmmelin
SAP Business Data Cloud - Head of Product Management Planning & Analytics,		Link
DA203v | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business WarehouseDominik Kurz
Product Expert SAP BW/4HANA & SAP BW Bridge
Klaus-Peter Sauer
Product Management SAP Business Data Cloud		 Link
Hands-on

Our hands-on workshop DA267 - Seamless planning for xP&A in SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) was another highlight. Preparing such sessions is a big task but it always is worth the effort. Luckily, I was supported by @jie_deng and @Matthew_Shaw who supported the preparation, the testing, and the session itself. The new live version feature for seamless planning was front and center in the workshop. Participants learned how to:

  • Build a seamless planning model from a view that is part of content shipped with Working Capital Insights Intelligent Application
  • Expose plan data in SAP Datasphere and bring it together with actual data in an analytic model
  • Extend the model with xP&A data and leverage the live version for calculations

The exercise and the tenants are still available! Check it out!

Exercise flow

Thanks to everyone for joining TechEd and for your interest in our content! Looking forward to 2026 already.

entry.title: SAP Developer News 13th November 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Sydney 

  • SAP TechEd home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

SAP BTP, ABAP environment ‚Äì Customer & Partner Roundtable 19 Nov 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/customer-amp-partner-roundtable-for-sap-btp-abap-environment-29-demo-time/ba-p/14263936  

ABAP Development Tools for VS Code: Everything You Need to Know 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-development-tools-for-vs-code-everything-you-need-to-know/ba-p/14258129 

Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-the-next-era-of-abap-development/ba-p/14260522 

SAP Open Source Webinar on open-sourced MCP servers 19 Nov 

  • Webinar details page (incl. registration) https://events.sap.com/open-sourced-mcp-servers-supporting-btp-platform-developers/en_us/home.html  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 

0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Sydney 

1:32 SAP BTP, ABAP Environment: Customer and Partner Roundtable 19 Nov 

2:01 ABAP Development Tools for VS Code: Everything You Need to Know 

3:19 Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development  

3:54 SAP Open Source Webinar on open-sourced MCP servers 19 Nov 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 13th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everyone. We're coming to you from Sydney, Australia. This is our first stop on TechEd on Tour. We got some of the team that's here in Australia. Say hi, everyone. Hi. We'll be doing hands-on sessions from the event as well as the developer garage. We're here in the developer garage on the show floor. There's Anne. Josh, what do we have planned from the community side? So we've got a lovely community corner here as we're calling it. We're actually asked the people how they like to navigate our Community website, as well as just the outreach. Having a meetup last night, a Stammtisch. We've got to keep doing that. Once I get on tour, we've got a couple more spots for me to go into. Having a lot of fun meeting with people in person. Yeah, it's been great energy. The Stammtisch last night, what would you say, 70, 80 people there or so? a good turnout and uh we're all this is our second week on the road uh for for many of us we'll be heading to uh Melbourne and uh Singapore next week for some CodeJams and then on to Bangalore for the last stop for the TechEd on Tour so uh continue to tune in to the SAP Developer News for updates on what's going on with the TechEd on Tour and if you're in any of those cities we're coming to, we're looking forward to seeing you in the coming weeks. Until then, have fun, everybody. Bye.

[Riley] Howdy, developers. If you're interested in ABAP, there's a customer and partner roundtable session scheduled for next week. It's happening on November the 19th. The ABAP product team will be going over several new features related to the release of 2511. They'll also be going over new ADT features as well. A Q&A session will follow. You can find details in Iwona Hahn's blog post, which is linked to below. Thank you.

[Mamikee] As we heard at TechEd Berlin 2025, we're rolling out ABAP Development Tools for VS Code. Here's what's in the scoop now and where to read more. From ABAP Development Tools for VS Code, Everything You Need to Know blog post, The first wave targets ABAP Cloud only, not dynpro or web dynpro, and starts with RAP UI services so front-end and back-end RAP can work and live in one place. It's an early adopter drop with roughly a dozen plus object types and the core develop-test-debug loop. Now for work outside of RAP UI services, keep Eclipse ADT in the mix for now. We'll catch up to Eclipse one client release at a time. We're reusing the ADT code base and moving tool to the LSP. Editing is file-based, which is great for today's AI workflows, and Joule for Developers is planned for VS Code. You can also use VS Code's AI extension. Just note, the virtual workspace model means some extensions may have limits. Now, backend support aligns with Eclipse down to SAP NetWeaver 7.3. From the Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development blog post, this puts VS Code inside the broader direction, modern tooling, plus AI-assisted development to boost productivity and make ABAP development feel at home with today's workflow. This post is the strategy view where the experience is heading and how AI features like Joule for Developers will evolve alongside the tooling. Now, you can read both of these blog posts in the link below.

[DJ] If you took part in Devtoberfest or caught some of the SAP TechEd content this year, then you may already be aware of SAP's adoption of the open Model Context Protocol, MCP, and the birth of open -source-based MCP servers for CAP, UI5, and Fiori development. Now is the perfect time to dig in and learn more and you're in luck because there's an SAP open source webinar on this very topic covering the three MCP servers I've just mentioned it's next week on Wednesday the 19th of November. There are three awesome big-brained experts David Kunz, Dominik Heim and Matthias Osswald and the webinar will cover the protocol itself and how these MCP servers can help. There'll be a live demo too, and you'll have a chance to ask questions. And it's free. Head over to the SAP Open Source webinars page to register. Link in the description.

entry.title: Recap SAP TechEd 2025: Discover, manage and control all your AI agents
entry.content:
Last week, we announced the general availability of the AI agent hub in SAP LeanIX. All existing customers can start discovering their agents from Microsoft, Google, and SAP immediately, or begin sending agent cards via the API. Detailed documentation can be found here. 


Below you find a recap of the most frequently asked questions. In case you missed the session, you can rewatch it here. 

  1. What is the AI agent hub all about?
    AI agent discovery is available now to all SAP LeanIX customers as part of the standard APM solution. For enterprise architects responsible for application landscapes, integrations, and governance, this capability provides a centralized, discoverable inventory of AI agents across cloud platforms and custom sources.
  2. When is it available?
    Availability: The feature is live and included in the standard APM module for SAP LeanIX customers.
    Documentation: Detailed setup and connector guidance is published on the SAP Help Portal | SAP Online Help. Read the documentation first for step-by-step configuration and supported connector behavior.
  3. How AI agents are discovered?
    LeanIX integrates natively with platform connectors. The Microsoft connector surfaces agents built on Microsoft cloud services (Azure AI Foundry, Copilot). The Google integration follows the same model with a current focus on agents configured on Google Agent Engine. The SAP integration captures used preconfigured Joule agents.
    If your agents are not built on Microsoft, Google, or SAP, you can still send them to LeanIX by sending agent metadata via the AI Agent API.
  4. What is the focus of the AI agent hub?
    LeanIX is a discovery and governance layer. It does not execute or orchestrate agents; it provides visibility and governance controls rather than runtime management.
  5. How are agents modelled in SAP LeanIX?
    AI Agents are modeled as a subtype of the Application Fact Sheet. This design supports joint application landscapes, incl. agents and data flows, while enabling agent-specific typing and conditional fields for clarity in the UI.
  6. How do you calculate an agent's business value?
    LeanIX provides a built-in, documented calculation to estimate the business impact of custom agents. This calculation is adaptable to your organization‚Äôs criteria and needs. 
  7. What are the SAP solution suggestions all about? 
    With the SAP solution suggestions you get a curated view in the context of your application landscape on which SAP AI agents and applications you are not yet using while having the technical set up in place.
  8. What is the commercial impact of the AI agent hub? 
    AI Agents are commercially relevant and treated as an Application subtype; they are licensed as discounted applications at a 1:5 ratio (apps : agents). The overall licensing approach remains application-based.
  9. What's next? 
    We focus on building integrations with major agent building platforms and discovering MCP servers to enable more comprehensive modeling of how agents, applications, and MCP servers are connected in your application landscape.

entry.title: CAP Highlights from TechEd 2025 and Devtoberfest 2025 ‚Äì a Recap
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

the fall of 2025 was an exciting time: We had two great events - Devtoberfest 2025 and SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì showcasing the latest developments, tools, and best practices in the SAP ecosystem. Let's take a closer look at the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) highlights from each event.

 

CAP @ SAP TechEd 2025: A Commitment to Developers

This year, SAP TechEd was a hybrid event, offering both in-person experiences in Berlin and virtual participation. We hope you had the chance to join us in person, as my colleague Alon Shachar did. He shares his impressions in his blog post ‚ÄúSAP Build introducing intent-based development for Application Development @ SAP TechED‚Äù.

As always, the event featured hundreds of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities. This year, developers and their needs were addressed in numerous sessions, with CAP being a prominent part in many of those sessions. For an overview of all the CAP related sessions at SAP TechEd 2025 I recommend reading this blog post. You didn‚Äôt have the chance to attend the event in Berlin? You still have the chance to join one of the SAP TechEd on Tour events. And you can watch the recordings that are available for some of the sessions. Find below a summary of the CAP related recordings.

 

Keynote: Developers at the Center

The keynote ‚ÄúBeyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next‚Äù addressed the evolving role of developers in an AI-driven world. It explored how SAP's latest technologies and tools are empowering these roles. We saw many exciting announcements and demos. My colleague Friederike Marby, for example, gave a great demo showcasing how to build an intelligent CAP application through intent-based development using SAP Build. You missed it? Here is the link to the recording: Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next.

 

Strategy Talk: AI-Assisted Developer Tools

The strategy talk ‚ÄúSAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools‚Äù highlighted latest innovations in SAP Build solutions.  In this session, my colleagues Alon Shachar and Ole Lilienthal showcased how AI-assisted tools and enhancements are enabling developers to create extensions and applications more efficiently. With in-depth CAP demos Ole and Alon presented, how these tools are designed to help developers and partners build at scale, with AI as a co-pilot rather than a replacement. I highly recommend you to watch the session: SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools.

 

Roadmap Session: Clean Core and Extensibility

In the roadmap session "Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying Clean Core & LoB extensions" Alon Shachar and Ole Lilienthal were telling us how SAP Build is evolving into a unified AI enabled platform built to extend our ecosystem. Attendees were introduced to the roadmap highlights across application development in SAP Build solutions, including updates for the Joule copilot, CAP, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These advancements aim to boost productivity and support the clean core concept and extensibility for line-of-business apps.

 

Devtoberfest 2025: CAP in the Spotlight

Devtoberfest is always a great opportunity to get ready for SAP TechEd. Devtoberfest 2025 continued its tradition as a virtual, community-driven event. This year, Fridays were dedicated to CAP, with a strong lineup of sessions that balanced practical enablement, new features, and forward-looking demos.

You were not able to take part? No worries ‚Äì all sessions have been recorded: From building enterprise grade CAP applications to integrating AI into CAP application development and exploring new tools: here's what developers learned in the various CAP related sessions.

 

Building Enterprise Grade CAP applications using BTP Developer's guide

This session focused on enhancing CAP applications with enterprise grade capabilities. Key features discussed included audit logging, change tracking, attachments, and multitenancy. These capabilities are crucial for making applications robust and scalable. The session also highlighted the importance of following the best practices described in the SAP BTP Developer's Guide to achieve these enhancements.

 

Get to know more about CAP‚Äôs documentation offering

Documentation is a vital resource for developers, and this session provided insights into CAP's documentation offerings. Attendees learned how to provide feedback, work effectively with sample projects, and contribute to improving the CAP documentation. The session emphasized the collaborative nature of the CAP community and how developers can help enhance the learning experience for others.

 

Integrating S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs into CAP Made Simple

This session was demonstrating that integrating SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition APIs into CAP projects can be simple. Attendees gained guidance on authentication, service consumption, and best practices for scalability and maintainability, equipping them to accelerate their integration projects.

 

Less code, same logic ‚Äì reduce your custom handlers by using new CAP features

CAP‚Äôs philosophy has always been to minimize boilerplate and repetitive code, e.g. via the built-in handlers for all standard CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) operations. This session introduced new features that further reduce or even eliminate the need for custom handler logic. This not only simplifies code but also reduces maintenance efforts and potential bugs.

 

Status-Transition Flows

This session covered the new Status-Transition Flows capability. This feature allows developers to define status and status-transition flows directly in CDS models using annotations. The required handlers are automatically generated. Developers retain the flexibility to override generated logic when complex scenarios demand custom implementations. This approach offers flexibility while maintaining control over complex scenarios.

 

Taking UI5 Server Side Rendering to the next level with AI

AI is transforming all areas of development, including UI development. This session showcased how you can use AI to automatically generate SAPUI5 views from CAP entity definitions offering a glimpse into the future of dynamic, short-living UIs generated from OData services.

 

CAP Tools ‚Äì What's New and Hot

The tooling session highlighted latest enhancements in CAP tools. Notable updates included IntelliJ support, new linter checks helping to maintain code quality in custom implementations, and CLI enhancements improving debugging workflows, deployment processes, and REPL (Read Evaluate Print Loop) interactions. These improvements enhance the day-to-day development experience.

 

Best Practices in CAP‚Äã

This session provided insights into the effective use of CAP. Daniel Hutzel, the CPO and founder of CAP, shared valuable guidance on both the recommended best practices and common pitfalls to avoid when working with CAP.

 

Testing SAP CAP Node.js apps with cds.test

Testing is critical for reliable applications. The testing session provided comprehensive coverage of automated testing strategies for CAP Node.js applications. Using the cds.test framework, attendees learned how to set up and execute tests for CAP services, focusing on core scenarios such as validating service APIs and handling business logic.

 

SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI‚Äã

This session introduced an enhanced tool for automating the conversion of service layers from XS Classic or XS Advanced into modern CAP-based services. By leveraging generative AI, developers can accelerate service layer migration to CAP, reducing manual effort and enabling faster cloud-native transformation.

 

Agentic Coding with CAP‚Äã

The agentic coding session introduced the new MCP server for CAP, which significantly enhances the capabilities of AI agents by providing them with comprehensive context and relevant examples, effectively transforming them into CAP development experts.

 

Plug'n'Ask: Enabling AI Context in CAP Through the Power of Plugins And MCP

During this session we explored into the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and how it can be integrated into CAP applications through plugins and annotations in CDS definitions. Developers learned how to empower their applications to communicate with LLM clients, providing context for the data within their applications.

 

CAP console‚Äã

Participants were introduced to the new CAP console, a native application designed to streamline the deployment and monitoring of CAP applications on SAP BTP. Embracing the grow-as-you-go philosophy, this tool simplifies the initial deployment process and offers robust monitoring features, all from a locally running app. Built by developers for developers, the CAP console allows developers to focus on coding rather than infrastructure challenges.

 

Conclusion

It's exciting to see how CAP continues to evolve, offering new possibilities and simplifying complex tasks. Both Devtoberfest 2025 and SAP TechEd 2025 provided many valuable insights for developers working with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. From core development practices to AI-powered innovations, the sessions offered a comprehensive look at all the great features of CAP. Whether you attended these events in person or followed along virtually, the shared experiences and learnings will surely inspire your next project.

If you missed any sessions, as mentioned above, all the sessions listed in this blog post are available on demand. It‚Äôs worth catching up - there‚Äôs a lot to learn. Until next time, keep coding. üòä

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025 Virtual: Experience the best of SAP TechEd and broaden your SAP security expertise
entry.content:
You missed SAP TechEd Berlin? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì we recorded many sessions for you, and they‚Äôre available free of charge on the virtual SAP TechEd platform.  
Check out these three security sessions:

Road map for security and compliance services in SAP BTP (XP802v)
Rakefet Jackoby Galazan and Michael Friedrich lead you through the road map for security, identity and access management, and compliance services in SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). Learn about upcoming features and enhancements that boost protection, help ensure regulatory alignment, and support more-secure, scalable cloud architectures.

Insider threats: Security versus AI and analytics (CA100v)
Insider threats‚Äîwhether intentional or accidental‚Äîcontinue to challenge organizations, demanding a proactive and adaptive defense strategy. Slim Trabelsi and Chase Kilburn dive into the design of a comprehensive insider threat program that integrates behavioral analytics and AI-driven monitoring to detect and mitigate risks effectively.

From control to confidence: What‚Äôs ahead for security and compliance at SAP (CA815v)
Sabrina Himmer and Patrick Boch give an outlook on future security features and tools within SAP Business Suite. Additionally, they dive into the streamlining process for compliance regulations that SAP and SAP Business Suite will adhere to now and in the future.

Join the SAP Security and the SAP TechEd Communities to stay up to date ‚Äì and sign up for the monthly SAP Security Newsletter to get all the latest news delivered directly into your inbox!

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore: Get Certified, Connect, and Learn Onsite
entry.content:
SAP TechEd on Tour is coming to Bangalore, bringing the SAP Community together for two days of hands-on learning, innovation, and collaboration. This year‚Äôs stop offers a special opportunity to get certified on-site for free, plus access to exclusive learning resources and community talks designed to boost your career. 

Join the Community Talks 

Kick off your experience by joining 20-minute Community Talks hosted by SAP experts and SAP Champions. These sessions will cover the latest news on SAP Certifications and how to prepare for them.

Featured sessions include: 

November 25, 2025

  • CT1006 | From Rookie to SAP Champion - Learn, Certify, Lead Your SAP Career
    Time: 1:30 PM - 1:50 PM
    Learn how SAP certifications and learning journeys can elevate your career.
    Speaker: Kunal Bansal, SAP Champion, Solution Architect, IBM

  • CT1007 | Get the Scoop on SAP Certifications
    Time: 2:00 PM - 2:20 PM
    Discover the roadmap to skills recognition through SAP Certification.
    Speaker: Timo Schuette, VP Product & Solution Learning, SAP

November 26, 2025

  • CT1008 | Get the Scoop on SAP Certifications
    Time: 11:30 AM - 11:50 AM
    Discover the roadmap to skills recognition through SAP Certification.
    Speaker: Timo Schuette, VP Product & Solution Learning, SA
  • CT1002 | Driving Business Innovation with SAP's Generative AI Hub & Joule Agents
    Time: 12:00 PM - 12:20 PM
    Learn how SAP‚Äôs generative AI transforms workflows and decision-making through agentic AI. Speaker: Sidharth Gupta, Product Learning Expert, SAP

Register today by searching for the session ID in the catalog or by filtering for ‚ÄúCommunity Talks‚Äù to reserve your seat and explore the full lineup of sessions in this SAP Community blog.

Free SAP Certification at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 

As part of SAP TechEd on Tour, attendees can take one of two certification exams for free on November 25: 

  • CER101 | Generative AI Developer Certification 
  • CER102 | SAP Build Developer Certification 

It‚Äôs your chance to validate your expertise and gain an industry-recognized credential right at the event. Learn more here: learning.sap.com/teched/certifications.

Unlock a 25% Certification Discount 

Don‚Äôt miss out and secure your 25% discount by booking your SAP Certification exam through the SAP Store by December 19, 2025.  

Simply redeem your exclusive promo received in your registration confirmation at the checkout in the SAP Store until December 19. 

Explore the SAP TechEd Learning Zone 

Get a head start on your SAP TechEd journey with the Learning Zone, your destination for curated resources, hands-on materials, and expert insights to help you get exam-ready and expand your expertise. 

Make the most of your experience at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore with two days of learning, connection, and growth. 

See you in Bangalore!

entry.title: SAP Developer News 20th November 2025
entry.content:
ITEMS

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore  

  • SAP Teched home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 

  • @cap-js/advanced-event-mesh plugin https://github.com/cap-js/advanced-event-mesh 
  • CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-integration-suite/advanced-event-mesh/cap-plugin-for-sap-integration-suite-advanced-event-mesh 

UKISUG Connect 2025 

  • Event website https://www.ukisugconnect.co.uk/ 
  • Agenda https://virtual.oxfordabstracts.com/event/75555/program  

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-abap-environment-release-2511/ba-p/14257787 

Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

  • Devtoberfest details https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 
0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore 
0:50 CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 
1:21 UKISUG Connect 2025 
2:45 SAP BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äì Release 2511 
4:00 Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 20th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everybody. Welcome from the TechEd on Tour. We're here in Singapore today for a CodeJam, our second to last stop on the TechEd on Tour. Next week, we'll be in Bangalore for the big TechEd event there. Everybody looking forward to that? Yeah. Yeah. Yeah, right now we're here in the SAP offices of Singapore. And if you see behind us, there is Ella, the robotic barista, making Rich a hot chocolate right now. So we're enjoying the comforts of the SAP office and looking forward to seeing everybody in Bangalore next week. So until then, we'll see you there. See you there. Bye. Bye.

[Antonio] Hola, SAP developers. In case you missed it, there is a new CAP plugin in town. the Advanced Event Mesh Plugin. You can leverage this new plugin to easily connect your CAP application with SAP Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh and start publishing or consuming events. Check out the plugin documentation to find out more about how to set up this plugin. I'm including the links in the description. Happy eventing!

[DJ] The conference season is very much in full swing, keeping us developer advocates busy. From organizing and running Devtoberfest through giving the Developer Keynote and running the Developer Garage at TechEd in Berlin and lots more and now many of the team are playing a major role in the On Tour part of the event with a stop in Sydney one in Melbourne and now as you've seen from an earlier item in this very news episode one in Singapore on their way to Bangalore. Over on this side of the world we have coming up the SAP UK and Ireland user group conference Connect. It's a great event it's happening from Sunday the 30th of November through Tuesday the 2nd of December that's right It's like a family reunion lots of discussions take place learning is shared and friendships are made. I'm very honored to be there, I'm running two sessions a hands-on workshop on modeling with CAP's CDS and also a tech talk on local first development with CAP. If you're attending Connect, come along and say hello in fact come to the sessions - the only thing you need to bring is your curiosity. See you there!

[Mamikee] The latest SAP BTP ABAP Environment release 25.11 is here, and it has been available since November 15th. And it's packed with upgrades across ADT, RAP, Fiori, business configuration, integration, and more. So here's a few highlights you don't want to miss. First, big feature drops across the tooling. In ADT, you now get Ghost Text Keyword Completion as the new default. A new editor for email templates. You can create custom email templates using the Maintain Email Template apps and full business configuration set editing right inside ADT. Plus, macOS users, the graphical call timeline for ABAP traces is now supported. In RAP, you can now log base change documents as business events using the new syntax to READ ENTITY, with changes to inspect change operation and define global side effects that refresh UI properties automatically with a single keystroke. Now, this was only a handful of updates. For the full list of updates, read the blog post in the description below.

[Anja & Michael] Welcome here in Berlin TechEd 2025 on site it's so great we handed over from the Devtoberfest now we're here and a lot of TechEd tour stops will join. I'm very happy to have you here, I know that you joined the Devtoberfest and not just joining you did win the Devtoberfest. It's so amazing so what was your experience what did you like, what was your highlight of that? Devtoberfest was incredible. The opportunity to experience the different areas of SAP and to become exposed to those areas was incredible. Having a focus on web technologies, but being exposed to the other services that I was not exposed to prior was very eye-opening and made me a really deep, deep dive into those areas. So I was able to draw some insights that I could reflect back into my work at my work camp. And that's great and now being here on site being on TechEd so what did you ... was thinking or wishing for and what is your highlight here? Oh I was wishing for more and I got more more than that um it was really incredible because it was non -stop sessions um hands-on road mapping um in so many different areas it was uh morning to evening of of of consuming information that I can take back and be empowered with. So I'm very excited to go back and share what I've learned this week. Thank you so much. Thank you.

entry.title: From Intelligent Applications to Trusted Data: Accelerating Insight to Action for Business Analysts
entry.content:
Business analysts today are expected to turn complex datasets into insight faster than ever; analyzing trends, spotting opportunities, and ultimately providing line-of-business leaders with the information necessary to make informed decisions. To meet these demands, they need tools that simplify analysis, ensure data quality, and accelerate their path from question to actionable insight. 

At SAP TechEd 2025, SAP announced a suite of advancements designed to do just that‚Äîcontinuing to drive momentum across its data and AI portfolio. New intelligent applications, expanded access to curated data products in SAP Business Data Cloud, and deeper AI-driven assistance powered by Joule empower analysts to work smarter, make faster decisions, and deliver insights with confidence, all while maintaining governance and accuracy at every step.

Intelligent Applications: Purpose-Built Insights for Every Line of Business 

Intelligent applications in SAP Business Data Cloud continue to evolve, giving analysts prebuilt, AI-driven insights across domains like finance, HR, supply chain, and more. By embedding more intelligence directly into everyday workflows, these applications let analysts start with much of the foundational work already modeled, monitored, and enriched with AI‚Äîso they can focus on understanding trends, identifying gaps, and answering the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the data, rather than the mechanics of assembling it.  

The Value of Intelligent Applications at a Glance: 

  • Consistent, trusted data sources resulting in reliable, repeatable insights 
  • Less manual prep work and more time spent analyzing and interpreting 
  • Shorter analysis cycles through immediate access to prebuilt dashboards 
  • Higher trust and alignment through unified metrics and premodeled insights 
  • Clearer explanations behind anomalies, trends, and performance drivers
  • AI-enhanced recommendations tailored to each line of business 

Intelligent Applications by Line of Business

Key Updates and Expanded Use Cases 

Following up on the intelligent application announcement made at SAP Sapphire in 2025, SAP has expanded both previews and general availability. Spend Intelligence, Supply Chain Intelligence, and Revenue Intelligence are now in restricted public preview, while Finance Intelligence, People Intelligence, and Cloud ERP Intelligence private packages are generally available. Together, these additions broaden the library of ready-to-use insights business analysts can tap into with minimal setup.

  • People Intelligence: New HR-focused use cases now deliver deeper insight into recruiting, learning effectiveness, and employee performance. Analysts gain more accurate attrition predictions and intuitive dashboards that make it easy to compare trends and risks across business units.  
  • Revenue Intelligence: Expanded capabilities provide revenue and sales leaders with a real-time, holistic view of pipeline performance. These updates combine continuously learning ML forecasts, automated variance detection, and unified insights across sales, finance, and operations to support more predictable planning and decision-making. 
  • Consumer Products Intelligence: A new intelligent application for consumer goods manufacturers helps optimize trade promotion planning and manage spending with greater precision. Features include real-time price elasticity analysis, promotion effectiveness insights, margin optimization tools, and streamlined workflows for executing financial operations. 

Trusted Data Products Fueling Reliable, Reusable Insights 

Data products remain one of the most impactful pillars of SAP Business Data Cloud‚Äîespecially for analysts who need quick access to context-rich and ready-to-use business data. Instead of repeatedly rebuilding the same datasets for each analysis or project, analysts can tap into governed, out-of-the-box data products that are automatically kept up to date. This not only eliminates duplication but also ensures that everyone across functional teams are working from the same source of truth. By standardizing reusable models, metrics, and pipelines, analysts gain a foundation that speeds up reporting cycles and reduces back-and-forth with technical teams. 

In summary, here's what data products bring to the table for business analysts: 

  • Reusable datasets reduce manual preparation and accelerate reporting cycles 
  • Shared metrics and models ensure consistent definitions across teams 
  • Faster insight generation with less time spent requesting or rebuilding data 
  • Increased trust in data quality, making findings easier to validate and share 

Momentum Continues: More Data Products Across SAP Applications 

SAP is expanding its catalog of ready-to-use data products across critical application areas, including SAP Cloud ERP, SAP SuccessFactors, sustainability, and customer experience. These additions will be available in SAP Business Data Cloud in H1 2026, giving business analysts access to richer, more discoverable datasets to support planning, reporting, and advanced analysis.

Overview: Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud

AI Assistants and Augmented Workflows: Work Smarter, Act Faster 

SAP‚Äôs latest advancements in AI assistants and automation deliver clear benefits to business analysts. SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) already offers strong AI capabilities, including natural language querying and machine learning-powered insights, that provide analysts with a robust foundation for faster data exploration and discovery. 

SAP is extending SAC with even more powerful, automated, and generative workflows designed to accelerate both analysis and planning: 

  • Story Generation Agent ‚Äì Automatically transforms raw data, business context, and user prompts into complete, insight-rich SAC stories or intelligent applications. It assembles visualizations, narrative structure, and recommendations using reusable components and user preferences. 
  • AI-assisted workflows for planning and analytics ‚Äì Includes comment summarization, comment translation, and natural language generation of advanced formulas. Analysts can describe complex planning logic conversationally and have SAC generate or refine the script behind it.
  • Joule embedded natively in SAC ‚Äì Provides in-context conversational support to help analysts refine queries, adjust dashboards, troubleshoot logic, or accelerate iterative analysis directly within the product. 

Joule Capabilities in SAP Analytics Cloud (2026)

Why This All Matters for Business Analysts 

Across intelligent applications, curated data products, and AI-assisted workflows, the message is clear: SAP is removing the friction that slows analysts down and elevating their work to more strategic, impactful roles. Built natively into SAP Business Data Cloud, these capabilities ensure analysts can work within a single, unified environment where data, analysis, and decision support are seamlessly connected. Analysts can now rely on workflows that are more automated, consistent, and cross-functionally integrated. The outcome: faster answers to critical business questions, clearer recommendations for business leaders, and more time spent on the high-value analytical work that drives real business impact. 

To learn more about SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP‚Äôs latest announcements: 

  • Visit SAP Business Data Cloud on sap.com 
  • Read the H2 2025 SAP Innovation Guide for key highlights 
  • Watch the replays from SAP TechEd 2025 virtual sessions: 
    • SAP Business Data Cloud solution road map (DA806v)
    • Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud (DA207v) 
    • Transforming how people work with Joule technology (ST123v) 
  • Get hands-on with the SAP BDC Getting Started workshop series (on-demand)

In addition, you can explore other innovations from SAP BDC by persona: for Data Stewards/Owners and Data Scientists.

entry.title: Building Pro-Code Extensions for SAP Mobile Start leveraging mobile native functionalities
entry.content:
We just concluded this year's SAP TechEd with two very insightful in-person events ‚Äì SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin (Nov 4‚Äì5) and SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore (Nov 25‚Äì26). As depicted in the announcement blog post of my colleague Thilo Berndt, the mobile topics were again very well covered in various sessions and activities. As part of which, we were conducting a Hands-on Workshop both in Berlin and Bangalore called "CA260 ‚Äì Learn how to build your own app and use it in SAP Mobile Start", which we would like to recap in this blog post and highlight the most interesting technical aspects.

Overview

SAP Mobile Start is the native entry point to the SAP Business Suite, to all relevant business processes, data, and content. It provides access to native or web-responsive business apps along with other content and critical business information. This includes notifications and consolidated views on tasks, approval workflows, and SAP S/4HANA situations. SAP Mobile Start provides business information from SAP Start, SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, and SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. Non SAP content can be integrated as well. It runs on iOS, iPadOS and Android devices, on watchOS and Wear OS devices, and on Apple Vision

While one significant aspect of SAP Mobile Start is to provide access to SAP‚Äôs role-specific standard content, such as business applications and tiles exposed from SAP S/4HANA via SAP Build Work Zone, this year‚Äôs SAP TechEd Hands-On Workshop CA260 centered on the ease of building pro-code extensions using SAP Build and specifically SAP Build Code with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Participants were able to experience the necessary steps in building and deploying such a pro-code extension, as well as how to specifically utilize mobile native capabilities within that extension, such as Widgets (e.g. on the iOS Home and Lockscreen) and (Push) Notifications.

The session material and exercises are available on Github within the repository SAP-samples/teched2025-CA260. We do highly recommend checking out the exercises and trying them out on your own development system environment. This blog post will provide a brief overview of the most important steps and technical activities. 

Please note that the session material on Github as well as some screenshots and code snippets in this blog post will contain usages of "###" as a placeholder for the participant number that was assigned in the hands-on workshop. Participants were instructed to replace these occurrences with their own participant number.

Building and Deploying the base version of the extension

The exercises started by building and deploying an initial version of the extension that the workshop is using as an example. As the initial version provided to participants, we are using a slightly modified version of the "Incidents Management" CAP sample application. The provided full-stack application and its dependencies are defined in the Multitarget Application descriptor (mta.yaml) which is being built and packaged into an mta archive (.mtar) during the build operation, which eventually gets deployed to the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), specifically SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment. While the workshop is making use of SAP Build Code and its productivity tooling for developing full-stack applications with CAP, building the MTA project and deploying the build artifact to the SAP BTP, you can as well use your IDE of choice such as Visual Studio Code.

Screenshot: Overview of the project structure

 With the deployment, the CAP application (in terms of the server logic) is running an application container on the Cloud Foundry Runtime. The UI of our full-stack application is realized using SAP Fiori Elements, which is generating the User Interface based on standard floorpans and UI annotations as part of the service definitions using CDS. The Fiori frontend application lives within the HTML5 Repository of the SAP BTP. While this would already be sufficient to expose our extension to SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start as an application tile and run the frontend within the shell of SAP Build Work Zone using its managed Approuter, we want to have more control over the visual representation. 

Frontend deployed to the HTML5 Repository; backend application deployed to Cloud Foundry

We can achieve this greater control by leveraging SAP Build Work Zone's content definition format ‚Äì the Common Data Model (CDM). The definition of which is documented here and represents a standardized data structure for defining business apps, their visual representation, the required roles, and the logical hierarchical structure in which business apps shall be organized using a concept called "Spaces & Pages". Such CDM structure can be supplied to the HTML5 Repository during deployment of our extension. In the workshop's repository, this definition resides in the /workzone/cdm.json file.

Integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone & SAP Mobile Start

For integrating our extension into SAP Build Work Zone, which makes it automatically available to SAP Mobile Start, we leverage a relatively new feature of the SAP Build Work Zone Channel Manager ‚Äì defining a HTML5 Business Solution. While we could also create a regular Content Provider, using the new Content Channel type "HTML5 Business Solution" further simplifies the process as we are not required to manage any design-time destination. The HTML5 repository is merging all deployed HTML5 applications and their CDM definition from a common "Business Solution", making it available for selection as a joint Content Channel by the "Business Solution" dropdown.

Creation of a HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel in SAP Build Work Zone

This value used for merging multiple HTML5 application belonging to the same business solution is done via a dedicated property ("service" under "sap.cloud") in the web applications manifest.json. If you want to read more about HTML5 Content Consumption capabilities of SAP Build Work Zone, we can recommend this excellent blog post from our colleague Rupam who is part of the SAP Build Work Zone team.

{
  "_version": "1.65.0",
  "sap.app": {
    "id": "com.sap.ca260.###",
    "type": "application",
    [...]
  },
  [...]
  "sap.cloud": {
    "public": true,
    "service": "ca260###"
  }
}

 After adding the Content Channel's role to our Site and making sure we have the role assigned to our desired users, we can see it exposed in SAP Build Work Zone using the browser as well as in SAP Mobile Start ‚Äì Nice! As defined in the /workzone/cdm.json file, the application tile of our built extension is placed onto a Page with the title "Apps from Participant CA260-000", which itself is available under a Space named "Extensions from CA260".

Deployed application visible in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

Extending the app to make use of Widgets on your mobile device

The steps to extend now our application in order for it to be configurable as a Widget, for example on the iOS Homescreen or the Lockscreen, are actually much easier than you might think. SAP Mobile Start offers multiple types of Widgets. The one we will be using here is the "Business Info Widget", which can be configured to display any KPI that is available to SAP Mobile Start. In technical terms this means that we need to enhance the application tile of our extension to become a "Dynamic App Launcher". In the simplest case, these are tiles showing a number coming from a connected data service. In more complex scenarios, these can also display criticalities, trend and more information around the selected KPI.

The process to transform our basic tile into a Dynamic App Launcher is fairly simple. Within our web application's manifest.json file, we can add the required definition to make it such a dynamic tile and connect it to our OData service for incidents available in our CAP application. For our example, let's point to the OData count of incidents and filter for incidents that are not in status closed using the status_code property. The needed configuration resides within the inbound definition under the node "indicatorDataSource". In order to make this change visible on our environment, the updated version needs to be deployed and the Content Channel needs to be synced.

Transforming the application tile into a DynamicAppLauncher

 As a result, our application now appears a KPI tile on our Site and in SAP Mobile Start and we can monitor the automatically updated value both inside of SAP Mobile Start ‚Äì for example when accessing the Page or by adding the app into my favorites on the Start tab of SAP Mobile Start. This fact allows us to configure the same Dynamic App Launcher tile as a Widget, for instance to our iPhone's Homescreen.

Pro tip: Why not mirroring your iOS Widget of open incidents to your Mac or configure the same on your Apple Watch as a watch face complication?

The Dynamic App Launcher tile appearing in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

 

Implementing our own (push) notifications

Let's now go one step further and implement our own notifications from our CAP application. The beauty of the integration via SAP Build Work Zone and SAP's notification framework leveraging the SAP Alert Notification Service on BTP is, that such notifications will automatically appear on our SAP Build Work Zone Site in the browser, in SAP Mobile Start under the notification bell as well as be delivered as a mobile native push notification to the mobile devices on which you use SAP Mobile Start. That's a game changer for informing your users about a time critical situation directly from your pro-code extensions.

For CAP based extensions, we can make use of the @cap-js/notifications plugin. The plugin communicates with the necessary APIs using a Destination that needs to be created in the SAP BTP Subaccount in which the application will run. By default it expects the name for the Destination to be SAP_Notifications if not configured differently. The values for this Destination can be retrieved from the Settings of SAP Build Work Zone (Administrator role required).

For sending actual notification from our CAP service, we need to define our desired NotificationTypes first in the /srv/notification-types.json. These defined types represent the blueprint for the actual notifications to be sent. They include the texts for the actual notifications in all the languages that shall be supported with dedicated placeholders which will be filled when the notification is actually triggered in the service logic. Below you can see an example for such a type:

{
    "NotificationTypeKey": "IncidentCreated",
    "NotificationTypeVersion": "1",
    "Templates": [
      {
        "Language": "en",
        "TemplatePublic": "New Incident created",
        "TemplateSensitive": "New incident created by {{customer}}",
        "TemplateGrouped": "Incident Status Update",
        "TemplateLanguage": "mustache",
        "Subtitle": "{{description}}"
      },
      {
        "Language": "de",
        "TemplatePublic": "Neuer Vorfall eingegangen",
        "TemplateSensitive": "Neuer Vorfall von {{customer}}",
        "TemplateGrouped": "Vorfall Status √Ñnderungen",
        "TemplateLanguage": "mustache",
        "Subtitle": "{{description}}"
      }
    ]
  }

Sending actual notification is fairly easy and can be done with very few lines of code. We first need to initialize the notifications plugin with cds.connect.to('notifications'), which creates a handle with which we can send notifications later. Sending notifications can be done with the function alert.notify. Here, we reference the desired NotificationType (defined before), recipients and further properties and data related to this specific notification we intend to send.

Coding used to send notification when incidents are created and closed.

 

 

As a result, we receive a push notification at the event of incident creation and closure. Already in the push notification displayed by the mobile operating system, we see the defined texts from our NotificationType with the specific values filled for the specific incident object. When tapping on this push notification, SAP Mobile Start shows the full notification in the dedicated area of the mobile app. Using "Open in Browser" brings us to this specific incident in our SAP Fiori Elements application where we could take further action. This is achieved by supplying the Intent Based Navigation (IBN) information of our app ‚Äì consisting of the Semantic Object and Action defined in our web application's manifest. This allows SAP Mobile Start and SAP Build Work Zone to open the right application as a navigation target from the exposed content ‚Äì in our case, the SAP Fiori Elements application running the HTML5 Repository and exposed to SAP Build Work Zone using the HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel.  The deep link to the specific incident object is achieved by supplying a special navigation target parameter that SAP Fiori Elements supports for opening the desired "Inner App Route" ‚Äì in our example, the Object Page of a specific incident using its ID. Feel free to check out how this was done for this specific example in the repositories' code.

 

The notification details visible in SAP Mobile Start and the deep-link navigation to the SAP Fiori Elements application

 

Outlook

We hope we were able to show, how easy it is to create pro-code extensions, deploy them to the SAP BTP, integrate them into SAP Build Work Zone & SAP Mobile Start. The demonstrated examples of mobile native widgets and push notifications hopefully showed the ease of leveraging the mobile native device capabilities. Beyond the content of the CA260 Hands-On Workshop of SAP TechEd 2025, we would like to give you an outlook to what else would be possible with this basis.

The beauty of using the HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel Exposure in SAP Build Work Zone is that we have the flexibility and feature set of the Common Data Model (CDM) available. We could further extend the /workzone/cdm.json file to make use of even richer visualization capabilities ‚Äì for example by defining a declarative UI Integration Card. Such cards allow to achieve UI richt micro-experiences right on the Page's structure, for example displaying a short list of incidents with the most important information to get a brief overview as a processor. In the browser when consuming the page via SAP Build Work Zone, the card is rendered as a regular SAP UI5 UI Integration Card. In SAP Mobile Start, declarative cards are supported as mobile native UI elements. With a single declarative definition of such a card using the UI Integration Card framework, we can achieve native cross-platform support with a high quality user experience directly within SAP Mobile Start.

Having a UI Integration Card added to the Page in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

For further information on SAP Mobile Start related features and topics, please check our SAP Mobile Start documentation. Visit SAP Mobile Experience Community Page and click ‚Äúfollow‚Äù to get the latest development and innovation of our solutions. We look forward to hearing about your experience with these hands-on exercises; please do share your thoughts and comments below.

entry.title: Integration Modernization @ SAP TechEd - A Recap
entry.content:
The Integration Modernization Team was part of this year‚Äôs TechEd event in Berlin. 

Let‚Äôs check some highlights, especially the workshops in the context of integration modernization with SAP BTP Integration Suite.

IN161 | Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud

This Workshop gave us the opportunity to understand how companies can migrate from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite.‚Äù

  • Assess and Plan: Evaluate existing scenarios and estimate migration effort with built-in assessment tools.
  • Automate Migration: Use semi-automated tooling and pattern-based templates to accelerate transformation.
  • Ensure Reliability: Leverage cloud pipelines for guaranteed delivery, error handling, and restart capabilities.

Content: https://github.com/SAP-samples/teched2025-IN161

IN163 | Implement Exactly Once In-Order Delivery in SAP Integration

This Workshop was focused on ensuring data consistency in message exchange by implementing Exactly Once In-Order (EOIO) delivery within SAP Integration Suite.

  • EOIO Concept: Guarantees messages are delivered without duplication and in their original sequence.
  • Implementation Options:
    • Exclusive Queues in Cloud Integration.
    • Partitioned Queues using Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) for high-scale scenarios.

Content: https://github.com/SAP-samples/teched2025-IN163

IN165 | Experience Event-Driven Integration with Advanced Event Mesh

In this Workshop we explored how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh enables scalable, secure event-driven architectures with features like event replay, filtering, and multi-protocol support.

  • Core Concepts: Learn queues, topics, and filtering to build robust event-driven solutions.
  • Advanced Features: Explore event replay, distributed tracing, and fine-grained filtering for complex scenarios.
  • Enterprise Scale: AEM supports multi-cloud and on-premise deployments, offering high performance, security, and protocol support (JMS, REST, AMQP, MQTT).

Content: https://github.com/SAP-samples/teched2025-IN165

IN302 | Run Integration Scenarios in Private Landscapes with Edge Integration Cell

This Depp Dive explained how to extend SAP Integration Suite to private environments using Edge Integration Cell, enabling hybrid integration scenarios with full control and compliance.

  • Private Deployment: Run integration flows in your own data center or private cloud for sensitive workloads.
  • Hybrid Architecture: Combine cloud-based integration with on-premise execution for flexibility and security.
  • Enterprise Readiness: Ensure governance, monitoring, and lifecycle management across distributed landscapes.

Content: 

IN166 | Central Monitoring of Integration Scenarios with SAP Cloud ALM

This workshop gave us the opportunity to see how SAP Cloud ALM provides a central cockpit for monitoring integration scenarios across hybrid landscapes.

  • Integration & Exception Monitoring: Get an overview of failed messages and exceptions across SAP Integration Suite and connected systems.
  • Health Monitoring: Track critical resources like JMS queues and expiring certificates to prevent disruptions.
  • End-to-End Visibility: Drill down to single message details and jump context-sensitively to local monitoring for issue resolution.
  • Alerts & Notifications: Activate alerts and receive automated email notifications for proactive incident handling.

Content: https://github.com/SAP-samples/teched2025-IN161

 

There‚Äôs a lot to look forward, and we‚Äôll see what 2026 brings with it:

SAP Innovation Guide: SAP Innovation Guide 

Integration Suite RoadMap: Integration Suite Road Map 

SAP Integration Modernization Community: SAP Integration Modernization Community 

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? Feel free to reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

#Modernize #Integrate #Innovate ‚Äì SAP Integration Modernization TEAM

entry.title: SAP TechEd : Comment √ßa se passe vraiment ?
entry.content:
Un format pens√© pour apprendre et exp√©rimenter

SAP TechEd est l‚Äôune des conf√©rences phare de SAP. Elle est principalement d√©di√©e √† l‚Äôinnovation technique dans l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me SAP. L‚Äô√©v√©nement dure 3 jours et m√©lange diff√©rents formats pour r√©pondre √† tous les profils techniques : d√©veloppeurs, consultants, architectes et experts SAP.

Chaque journ√©e suit un rythme assez similaire. Les participants choisissent librement leur programme parmi des centaines de sessions techniques. Le premier jour fait exception avec deux keynotes. La premi√®re marque le lancement officiel de l‚Äô√©venement. La deuxi√®me, en fin de journ√©e, est d√©di√©e aux annonces sur les nouvelles technologies et aux derni√®res innovations.

Le choix des sessions : √† toi de construire ton agenda !

Contrairement aux autres √©v√®nements, c‚Äôest toi qui choisis. Les inscriptions aux sessions et workshops se font directement sur le site du TechEd ou via l‚Äôapplication SAP Events. C‚Äôest une √©tape importante, car certaines sessions ont un nombre de places limit√©es. Souvent les workshops se remplissent rapidement.

Les formats les plus pertinentes selon moi sont :

  • Sessions Deep Dive : 45 √† 60 minutes pour explorer un sujet en profondeur (ex : ABAP Cloud, SAP BTP, IA, int√©gration, s√©curit√©‚Ä¶)
  • Usability Testing : pour donner son avis sur les nouveaux outils et aider SAP √† am√©liorer l‚Äôexp√©rience utilisateur
  • Roadmap Sessions : pour comprendre o√π SAP va dans les prochains mois
  • Hands-On Workshops : pour tester directement les nouvelles technologies

Les workshops hands-on : le c≈ìur de TechEd

Les hands-on c‚Äôest ce qui rend TechEd unique. Pas seulement de la th√©orie, mais aussi de la pratique avec les experts du produit.
Le d√©roulement classique de tous les workshops:

  1. Tu re√ßois un sc√©nario ou un cas d‚Äôusage √† suivre
  2. Tu acc√®des √† un environnement SAP de d√©monstration qui souvent d√©j√† pr√©configur√©
  3. Tu d√©veloppes ou configures pas √† pas, avec l‚Äôaide d‚Äôexperts
  4. Tu peux poser des questions en live si tu bloques aux responsables du produits.

‚ö†Ô∏èLimite importante : SAP impose souvent un maximum de 2 workshops hands-on par personne. Une petite astuce existe pour en faire plus. Sur place, vous pouvez parfois r√©cup√©rer une place libre le jour J en arrivant en avance. Ce n‚Äôest pas garanti, mais √ßa peut fonctionner.

Certifications

SAP met souvent √† disposition des parcours d√©di√©s, des sessions cibl√©es pour pr√©parer des certifications. A la fin du TechEd des cr√©neaux sont propos√©s pour passer examens sur place.

Ce qui peut √™tre difficile

TechEd est un √©v√©nement technique. Il peut √™tre tr√®s dense pour des profils moins techniques. Autre difficult√© plus op√©rationnels :

  • Les environnements peuvent √™tre lents si beaucoup de monde se connecte en m√™me temps
  • Il faut choisir, et renoncer √† beaucoup de sessions int√©ressantes
  • L‚Äôagenda se remplit vite, surtout pour les workshops

Ce qui peut √™tre int√©ressant

  • Bien se pr√©parer en amont de l‚Äô√©venement en lisant les annonces sur les sessions choisis
  • Si possible, faire quelques exercices sur la BTP

Le vrai plus : les rencontres

Le TechEd, c‚Äôest aussi :

  • Rencontrer les experts SAP que nous avons l‚Äôhabitude de voir en ligne
  • √âchanger avec des personnes qui vivent les m√™mes projets que nous
  • Reconnecter la communaut√© technique dans la vraie vie
  • Partager des id√©es, des difficult√©s, des solutions
